sentences: Mary J. A. Wurm (her surname was originally Würm) (18 May 1860 in Southampton – 21 January 1938 in Munich) was an English pianist and composer.
She was born as Mary Josephine Agnes Würm in England, the sister of Alice Verne-Bredt, Mathilde Verne, and Adela Verne.
She studied piano with Clara Schumann and composition with Charles Villiers Stanford.
Wurm became a noted pianist, and in 1898 founded and conducted a women's orchestra in Berlin.
